articles.title: Chris Sale strikes out 5 in likely final rehab start, declares himself 'very ready' to rejoin Red Sox
articles.description: Chris Sale struck out five Triple-A batters in what could be his final rehab start before he returns to the Boston Red Sox rotation.
articles.content:
WORCESTER, Mass. -- Chris Sale struggled to calm himself down on Wednesday night in what was expected to be his last rehab start before he rejoins his teammates in Boston.

articles.title: New Orleans Pelicans' Zion Williamson after signing extension - Want to prove I'm a winner
articles.description: Zion Williamson's extension does not include a player option, something David Griffin says shows his "level of commitment to this organization."
articles.content:

articles.title: Detroit Tigers haven't heard from Eduardo Rodriguez since placing LHP on restricted list 3 weeks ago
articles.description: The Tigers have had no communication with Eduardo Rodriguez since placing the star pitcher on the restricted list three weeks ago, according to GM Al Avila, who said the team has "no choice but to wait it out right now."

articles.title: Nick Kyrgios reaches men's singles semifinals at Wimbledon
articles.description: Australian Nick Kyrgios, who is currently ranked No. 40 in the world, beat Cristian Garin to become the lowest ranked and first unseeded men's semifinalist at Wimbledon since 2008.
articles.content:
LONDON -- Nick Kyrgios advanced to the semifinals at a Grand Slam tournament for the first time by beating Cristian Garin 6-4, 6-3, 7-6 (5) on Centre Court at Wimbledon on Wednesday.
